title: Calendar design
content:
I’m planning on doing a Christmas project with my design students, and my idea is to let them make a calendar for the new year. In order not to end up with the usual suspects, I need to find some great inspiration. So my question to you is: Do you know any great websites where I can find some crazy / weird / unusual / exciting or just plain beautiful calendars? Thanks for the help!

 [‹ What's your desk, studio etc look like?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229050632/http:/typophile.com/node/948 "Go to previous forum topic") [Becoming Jane writing ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229050632/http:/typophile.com/node/38513 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Small Caps

comments.content: I don’t know if they can be seen online, but Pentagram has made beautiful calendars, some of which are shown in Alan Fletcher’s “Beware Wet Paint” and in Susan Yelavich’s “Profile—Pentagram Design”, both published by Phaidon in Europe.
